title: Linux build version script to hide exports of dependencies
body:
**Description of Change**

Currently symbols of Freetype etc. are exported during the linker process. This leads to errors when used with applications that load build in third party libraries.

**Bugs Fixed**

- Related to issue #927

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I see an error:
> /usr/bin/ld:/__w/1/s/native-builds/libSkiaSharp_linux/libSkiaSharp.map:7: syntax error in VERSION script

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Let me fire up a VM quick

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I think it was missing the last semicolon... Updated the code, so let's see.

Took a guess from the sample in https://www.gnu.org/software/gnulib/manual/html_node/LD-Version-Scripts.html

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Should have tested this after I rewrote everything from scratch :(

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Do you use a VM of WSL?

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Using a VM and running Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. Did a fresh clone. Let me check real quick what is happening.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Seems to have passed the build of libSkiaSharp for Linux.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Y same on my machine. Looks okay now.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: I wonder why Fontconfig is still exported. There seems to be a version script for glibc as well.
